Extract Kinship

Source: vignettes/kinship.Rmd
kinship.Rmd

Run simulation:

library(dplyr)
library(tekkamaki)

result = tekka('--seed=42 -y100 -l5 --sa 10,10 --sj 10,10') %>% print()
#> # A tibble: 1 x 2
#>   sample_family         demography          
#>   <list>                <list>              
#> 1 <tibble [13,779 × 6]> <tibble [9,645 × 5]>
sample_family = result$sample_family[[1L]] %>% print()
#> # A tibble: 13,779 x 6
#>       id father_id mother_id birth_year location capture_year
#>    <int>     <int>     <int>      <int>    <int>        <int>
#>  1   213         0         0         -4        1           NA
#>  2   214         0         0         -4        1           NA
#>  3   212       213       214          5        0           NA
#>  4   217         0         0         -4        1           NA
#>  5   218         0         0         -4        0           NA
#>  6   216       217       218          0        1           NA
#>  7   219         0         0         -4        1           NA
#>  8   215       216       219          6        0           NA
#>  9   211       212       215         11        1           NA
#> 10   222         0         0         -4        1           NA
#> # … with 13,769 more rows

Extract kinship with degree≤4:

kinship = find_kinship(sample_family, 4L) %>% print()
#> # A tibble: 255 x 5
#>     from    to path   degree label
#>    <int> <int> <chr>   <int> <fct>
#>  1     1    40 1110_1      4 HGUN 
#>  2     1    62 1100_1      4 HC   
#>  3     2    10 1100_1      4 HC   
#>  4     2    71 110_1       3 HUN  
#>  5     2   130 100_1       3 HUN  
#>  6     3    73 10_1        2 HS   
#>  7     3   126 100_1       3 HUN  
#>  8     4    16 1100_1      4 HC   
#>  9     4    31 110_1       3 HUN  
#> 10     4    58 110_1       3 HUN  
#> # … with 245 more rows

Bind other information to kinship data.frame:

sampled = sample_family %>%
  dplyr::filter(!is.na(capture_year)) %>%
  dplyr::transmute(id, location, capture_year, age = capture_year - birth_year) %>%
  print()
#> # A tibble: 200 x 4
#>       id location capture_year   age
#>    <int>    <int>        <int> <int>
#>  1     1        0           95     0
#>  2     2        1           95     0
#>  3     3        1           95     0
#>  4     4        0           95     0
#>  5     5        0           95     0
#>  6     6        0           95     4
#>  7     7        1           95     0
#>  8     8        1           95     0
#>  9     9        0           95     0
#> 10    10        0           95     0
#> # … with 190 more rows

kinship %>%
  dplyr::left_join(sampled, by = c(from = "id")) %>%
  dplyr::left_join(sampled, by = c(to = "id"), suffix = c("_from", "_to"))
#> # A tibble: 255 x 11
#>     from    to path  degree label location_from capture_year_fr… age_from
#>    <int> <int> <chr>  <int> <fct>         <int>            <int>    <int>
#>  1     1    40 1110…      4 HGUN              0               95        0
#>  2     1    62 1100…      4 HC                0               95        0
#>  3     2    10 1100…      4 HC                1               95        0
#>  4     2    71 110_1      3 HUN               1               95        0
#>  5     2   130 100_1      3 HUN               1               95        0
#>  6     3    73 10_1       2 HS                1               95        0
#>  7     3   126 100_1      3 HUN               1               95        0
#>  8     4    16 1100…      4 HC                0               95        0
#>  9     4    31 110_1      3 HUN               0               95        0
#> 10     4    58 110_1      3 HUN               0               95        0
#> # … with 245 more rows, and 3 more variables: location_to <int>,
#> #   capture_year_to <int>, age_to <int>
